artists.name: The Cam Jervis Experience
artists.description: For the last year in high school, my friends and I formed a band. I was on lead guitar, and played keys and sang vocals for some tracks. We rocked out at various local venues, benefit concerts and battle of the bands. While we played a couple original songs, we mainly played covers.

albums.name: Songs
albums.description: Originals and covers played by The Cam Jervis Experience

songs.name: Road to Want
songs.description: Progressive rock song Credits: Lead Guitar: Andrew Russell Rhythm Guitar: Adam Baigent Bass Guitar: Cam Jervis Didgeridoo: Adam Baigent Drums: Garry Garneau Music written by: The Cam Jervis Experience

songs.name: On Either Side
songs.description: Laid back folk Credits: Lead Vocals: Garry Garneau Backing Vocals: Adam Baigent, Andrew Russell, Cam Jervis Russian Lap Harp: Garry Garneau Guitar: Adam Baigent Piano: Andrew Russell Bass: Cameron Jervis Music written by Adam Baigent Lyrics written by Garry Garneau

songs.name: Farmhouse
songs.description: A rock ballad by the band Phish Credits: Lead Vocals: Andrew Russell Backing Vocals: Garry Garneau Lead Guitar: Andrew Russell Rhythm Guitar: Adam Baigent Piano: Cam Jervis Bass: Cam Jervis Drums: Andrew Russell Music written by Trey Anastasio Lyrics written by Tom Marshall

songs.name: El Scorcho
songs.description: A rock song by Weezer Credits: Lead Vocals: Garry Garneau Lead Guitar: Andrew Russell Rhythm Guitar: Adam Baigent Rock Organ: Andrew Russell Bass: Cam Jervis Drums: Andrew Russell

artists.name: The Orfs
artists.description: While I was the pianist in the University of Waterloo's Stage Band, the stage band's guitarist invited me to play with his band. The Orfs, a pyscedelic rock band, is led by Grant Kouzechar who writes most of the music we play. The rest of the songs are covers from various artists. I played the keys in this band using a number of sounds ranging from the piano to the organ and even the clavicord.

softwareProjects.name: Personal Website
softwareProjects.description: This is the source for both the server side and client side code required for running this website. Node.js required to run the server.

softwareProjects.name: Defend Your Castle
softwareProjects.description: Lovingly ripped off of the popular flash game. I created this game for a UI assignment at the University of Waterloo. The goal of this game is to kill all of the attacking stick figures by dropping them from a great hight before they knock down your castle.

softwareProjects.name: Soccer Emulator
softwareProjects.description: A soccer emulator I made for as a mini-game for an online, text-based RPG. NOTE: Windows only

softwareProjects.name: Carz
softwareProjects.description: A game I originally saw on a TI-83 graphing calculator.Try to keep your car inside the lines. NOTE: Windows only. Sometimes has framerate issues and runs too fast

softwareProjects.name: Conway's Game of Life
softwareProjects.description: An implementation of Conway's Game of Life using OpenGL

softwareProjects.name: Pong
softwareProjects.description: Pong, teh awesome game. Implemented with C++ and OpenGL. What more can be said? NOTE: Windows only

softwareProjects.name: Hearts
softwareProjects.description: An implementation of hearts I made while learning perl. Needless to say, I have not used perl since.

workProjects.name: Synthesis Engine Prototype
workProjects.description: Prototype of the new concept synthesis engine spec, with a focus on performance.

workProjects.name: Label-to-Concept Engine Prototype
workProjects.description: Prototype of the new label-to-concept engine spec, with a focus on result quality.

workProjects.name: Content Scoring Engine Prototype
workProjects.description: Prototype of the new content scoring engine spec, with a focus on a smoother range of content scores.

workProjects.name: Virtual Surround Sound Driver
workProjects.description: Driver that takes stereo input audio and outputs 5.1 virtual surround sound.

workProjects.name: Accessibility API
workProjects.description: Accessibility features for a public API that enable blind and low vision users to consume applicaitons written with the API.

workProjects.name: Internal Native Client Demo
workProjects.description: Native client application used for demo certain native client capabilities.

workProjects.name: Speech Enabled Text Adventure
workProjects.description: Browser extension that allows speech to text input and text to speech output for text adventure games based on the Parchment engine.

workProjects.name: Internal TouchUI Demo
workProjects.description: Clone of an existing internal demo as a web application using TouchUI

workProjects.name: TouchUI
workProjects.description: Library to help create Web Applications that mimick native applications for mobile devices.

workProjects.name: Audio Driver Emulator
workProjects.description: Implemented an audio driver for the Symbian OS emulator on Windows for a specific line of smartphones.

workProjects.name: Issue Tracking System
workProjects.description: New web front end for the internal work item tracking system.

workProjects.name: ASReml Batch
workProjects.description: Tool for running large number of ASReml calculations and for running further statistical calculations over the results.

schoolProjects.description: Automatic meeting transcription tool, recognizing both who is speaking and what is being said.
OpenGL application featuring flocking, L-System plants, terrain erosion and water rippling systems.
Panoramic stitching program that takes arbitrary images and recognizes both if and how they are connected, and then composes the connected images.
Simple, real-time operating system implemented for a Motorola 68k series chip.
